at each birth event increased from an average of 10 out of 29 practices prior to introduction of 
the Checklist to an average of 25 out of 29 practices after the Checklist had been introduced.2
Following this pilot study in Karnataka, a large randomized control trial was designed to follow 
116 000 births across Uttar Pradesh, the most populous state in India. This trial – the BetterBirth 
Programme – which is still ongoing, will determine the effect of a successful Checklist introduc-
